No, I can't. I have to do something.
page 145: Maybe I can keep helping people. Damn the King and his war, I'll help people in other ways.
My plans remain the same. I'll head straight for Castle Oren. I'm sure the King needs me, and won't mind.
page 5: I'm not having this. Bertrand should get them out of here.
Fine. If Bertrand is so hesitant, I'll do it myself.

page 2: I need to leave. There's nothing for me here.
I will not leave my home. If the king sends men here, I'll send them back.
page 1: Damn the king. He holds no power over me.
I've nothing better to do. I'll go to Castle Oren.
page 4: Take the path into the woods.
page 3: ... Then jump out and chase after the bandits, intent on killing them.
... Then let it go. Best to get out of here while they're gone.

I stay my hand. If he doesn't give an answer I like, I'll kill him.
page 9: Quickly slide my blade back onto my back and raise my hands. I just want to go.

I won't kill him. I know the pain he is going through, has been going through.

No. I won't take the easy way out. I'll hold out, as long as it takes.
page 94: I need to do something different with my life.
I won't change because the dead wish it.
